instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP5V_SO: What is PP5V_SO? PP5V_SO is a typo of PP5V_S0, which is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state. The person who typed PP5V_SO thought that the S0 in PP5V_S0 was SO, if you see PP5V_SO assume the user made a typo and meant to type PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message:
Hi. When I started this board I had PP3v42 but with no green light and no PPBUS. PP3v42 was 3.42V and PPBUS was shorted to ground.ISL was getting hot so I removed it and replaced ISL. I checked PPBUS in diode and most of the short was almost gone (0.386) but still no PPBUS. I plugged in the battery and that caused new ISL to short. PPBus was .012 in diode at this point. Removed new ISL and was back to 0.386 in diode on PPBUS. Plugged in battery with ISL removed and got PPBUS. Then I plugged in the charger as well and got green light for like 10 seconds but no fan spin. Then it turned off. Now things are worse than when I started. I have no PPBUS and no PP3v42. Voltage on F6905 is .475 now with new DCIN board. So Im not getting any power whatsoever. Not sure where to go from here. Thanks in advance. Have a good one.


Update: PPDCIN shorted to ground as well.

Update: Short was on <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> & <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>. Now I have voltage back. PP3v42 is back with a green light. Replaced ISL and now I have PPBUS @ 12.6V. But still no fan spin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message:
Of course!!! never apply voltage to a buck power supply without the controller (<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>), the mosfets will not know what to do and will send all the voltage applied to the circuit or to ground and something will be burnt...

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message: Hey man, how are ya? Thanks. LOL... OK. Lesson learned. With charger only I had PPBUS G3H, PP3v42, pp3v3. I was about to check <SIGNAL>PP5V_SO</SIGNAL> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> started to boil, as well as <CAPACITOR>C7553</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7561</CAPACITOR>. <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> also got very hot and I think its blown again. VIAs around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> are pretty discolored now. PPBUS is missing again. Diode mode is O.L. on PPBUS now. And just when everything was starting to look up. LOL. Thanks alot for the response.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message: The battery can only blow the ISL through the data bus. This battery is a killer and is the first thing to go in the trash. Also SMC probably got killed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message: No battery, only charger. plugged in on last attempt. I had PPBUS which seemed a little low in diode mode (.386) and PP3V42 both which I didnt have to begin with. Green light wassolid then started pulsing. All of a sudden <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> , <CAPACITOR>C7553</CAPACITOR> & <CAPACITOR>C7561</CAPACITOR> boiled. Im not sure yet about ISL, I had to leave. I now have PP3V42 with solid green light but 0 V on PPBUS. Resistance on PPBUS is OL (infinite). So I'm not sure where to go from here. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message: Update. Starting over. Came in this morning and replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> & <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>, ISL and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.  In diode mode G3H is .428, PP3V42 is .332. <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> has some lines that are beeping to ground. These are pins 10, 13, 16, 4 & 3. Im Fucked right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message:
As you can see in the board view:
Pin 3 is quite literally ground, so thats to be expected.
Pin 4 (<SIGNAL>CCCSAS0_RTN</SIGNAL>) is supposed to be connected to ground.
Pin 10 isn't supposed to be ground though, depends on the resistance. Might want to replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> if you can't find out why
Pin 13 is connected to ground through a 0 ohm resistor so its to be expected
Pin 16 (<SIGNAL>VCCSAS0_LL</SIGNAL>) is <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0</SIGNAL> before it goes through a coil and a resistor, so that has low resistance to ground. Its not supposed to be a direct short though. So that could mean you killed the CPU or dead <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, but post resistance in ohm first.

What is the resistance to ground in ohm for pin 10 and 16?

I would not say you're fucked, but after reading this topic I wouldn't be surprised its going to be a pain to fix

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message: Thanks man. Really appreciate the response and the explanation. That helps. Pin 10 is 0.6 Ohms and pin 16 is between 0.5 and 0.6 Ohm. I have replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. Just haven't put power to the board yet. Kind of hesitant to. I keep frying <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> & ISL. Running out of parts, so I want to be sure nothing is going to blow before I do. What else should I check? Thanks again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message: If <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> got hot and fried I'm pretty sure the CPU got fucked too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message: Pin that keeps frying is 17 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>,  <SIGNAL>VCCSAS0_DRVH</SIGNAL>. Thats output. What can this be? Burned hole through <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR>.  ???   Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
threads.message: If there is a hole in <TRANSISTOR>Q7100</TRANSISTOR> you can say goodbye to the CPU, its dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No PPBUS No PP3v42
